citation.article-title: Glycomyces scopariae sp. nov. and Glycomyces mayteni sp. nov., isolated from medicinal plants in China.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Glycomyces mayteni sp. nov.
Glycomyces mayteni (may′te.ni. N.L. n. Maytenus a botanical genus name; N.L. gen. n. mayteni of Maytenus, referring to the isolation of the type strain from tissues of Maytenus austroyunnanensis).
Aerobic actinomycete that forms yellowish-white (on ISP 2, ISP 3 and ISP 4 media) to cream–yellow (on ISP 5 and Czapek's agar) substrate mycelium and white aerial mycelium.
Waxy and plicate growth on most media.
Chains of square-ended conidia are produced on aerial mycelium (Supplementary Fig. S1).
Temperature range for growth is 15–37 °C, with optimal growth at 28 °C.
The NaCl concentration range for growth is 0–5 % and the pH range for growth is pH 6.0–8.0.
Additional physiological properties are given in Table 1.
The cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The whole-cell sugar pattern consists of galactose, glucose and xylose.
The predominant menaquinones are MK-11, MK-11(H4) and MK-10 (42 : 36 : 15 in the type strain).
Major fatty acids (>5 %) are iso-C16 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C17 : 0 and iso-C15 : 0.
The G+C content of genomic DNA of the type strain is 71.5 mol%.

The type strain, YIM 61331T (=KCTC 19527T =CCTCC AA 208004T), was isolated from surface-sterilized roots of Maytenus austroyunnanensis collected from a tropical rainforest in Xishuangbanna, Yunnan province, south-west China.
